intro: Psoralea eriantha, commonly known as the hairy psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its seed pods are hairy and contain several small, dark seeds. Psoralea eriantha is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
